page.title: 11CONDI'S POOL
page.content: The wetland area near the estuary is washed clear of mud by water escaping through sluice gates from a pond called Condi's pond.The pond fills at high tide when the sluice gates are open.Local people go fishing at Condi's pond.Fishing is a popular hobby and occupation for some of the local people.Their rowing boats are moored on the estuary.Many children go riding their bicycles near the wetlands.We call the waste ground the "cob"We go scrambling on our bicycles. When the tide is out,it is possible to cross the estuary from the Welsh side to the English side(Wirral) by walking.Great care is needed when walking across the sand.Fog can come down quickly.People have lost their way without a compass.The distance is approximately 5 mls.The estuary has been crossed in 20 minutes.
